thread.title: Huawei to Present at CTIA Super Mobility 2015 and Rural Wireless Summit
thread.title_full: Huawei to Present at CTIA Super Mobility 2015 and Rural Wireless Summit

author: admin
title: Huawei to Present at CTIA Super Mobility 2015 and Rural Wireless Summit
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/8/2015 @ 7:27 AM   Huawei 
LAS VEGAS, Sept. 8, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- CTIA -- Huawei will participate as a sponsor and present at two sessions at CTIA Super Mobility 2015 and the Rural Wireless Association's Rural Wireless Summit, taking place from Wednesday, September 9 to Friday, September 11 at the Las Vegas Sands Expo. 
"In partnership with tier three carriers and wireless internet service providers, Huawei is committed to bringing faster and reliable broadband connectivity to underserved rural communities in America," said Ming He, General Manager of U.S. Operations, Huawei Technologies USA. "These industry events present a great opportunity for us to showcase Huawei's scalable and cost-effective solutions that help rural operators develop robust networks." 
Huawei's executives will speak at two sessions: -- Future Mobile Networks - 4G Innovation Marches On: CloudRAN (Sept. 9, 3:30 p.m. - 4:30 p.m. at the Venetian Ballroom): Huawei's Dr. Mohamed Madkour, Vice President of Wireless Marketing and Solutions, will discuss the current status, test results and future plans of putting RAN functionality in cloud computing. -- Utilizing Hybrid Technology to Balance Economics and Subscriber Expectations (Sept. 10, 1:35 p.m. - 2:40 p.m. at the Rural Wireless Pavilion & Lounge): Huawei's Bill Gerski, Vice President of Wireline Sales, will moderate a panel discussion on how to apply hybrid approaches for overcoming population density, difficult terrain, and long distance challenges in providing services to rural areas. The discussion takes place in the Rural Wireless Summit Pavilion. Speakers include: -- Jeff Kohler, Co-Founder and Chief Development Officer, Rise Broadband -- Joe Franell, President and Chief Executive Officer, Eastern Oregon Telecom -- Rick Harnish, Broadband Consultant and Industry Analyst 
Throughout the show, Huawei's experts will be on hand to demonstrate an array of products including its industry-leading GOSP cabinet system, 98 percent efficient power rectifier system, wireless backhaul, distributed CCAP, optical solutions, power solutions, and its ATN multiservice access products. Huawei's booth at the Rural Wireless Summit is located at 6021-A. 
About Huawei Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Our aim is to enrich life and improve efficiency through a better connected world, acting as a responsible corporate citizen, innovative enabler for the information society, and collaborative contributor to the industry. Driven by customer-centric innovation and open partnerships, Huawei has established an end-to-end ICT solutions portfolio that gives customers competitive advantages in telecom and enterprise networks, devices and cloud computing. Huawei's 170,000 employees worldwide are committed to creating maximum value for telecom operators, enterprises and consumers. Our innovative ICT solutions, products and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. Founded in 1987, Huawei is a private company fully owned by its employees. 
For more information, please visit Huawei online at www.huawei.com or follow us on:
